items.title: Shift to Electric Cars Gives Design Centers a New Look, Too
items.abstract: Automakers are pouring money into research and development facilities, creating spaces intended for creativity and collaboration among design and engineering teams.

items.title: How New York City’s Trees and Shrubs Help Clear Its Air
items.abstract: As advocates are pushing the city to plant more trees, new research shows the role of urban greenery in absorbing carbon emissions.

items.title: Building an Urban Escape Vehicle
items.abstract: Riding a bike in New York has its own challenges. And the world-class mountain-bike trails just outside the city require a very different kind of bicycle.

items.title: City Will Place 1,500 Bollards to Counter Vehicle Attacks
items.abstract: Mayor Bill de Blasio said New York would spend some $50 million on safety measure, including installing metal posts around vulnerable pedestrian areas.

items.title: City’s Delayed Traffic Study to Guide Regulation of Uber Vehicles
items.abstract: The study, which was originally due at the end of November, aimed to assess the ride-hailing service’s effects on traffic congestion in Manhattan.
